instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: [SOLVED]Dark spot on right side of screen after LCD repair
threads.message:
Whats going on here? Looks like stage lights, every other light is off.

Don't see nothing blown on the inverter board. The one fuse though don't beep. But it looks like a fuse it's white. Do like larger type fuses not beep?

threads.title: [SOLVED]Dark spot on right side of screen after LCD repair
threads.message: Hi, bad led return resistors around backlight chip can do that.

threads.title: [SOLVED]Dark spot on right side of screen after LCD repair
threads.message:
One of the LED return lines is open. Could be a damaged LCD board, LCD cable, LEDs strip, or something on the board.
This is the reason you do not mess with 13" Air assemblies. LCDs are way too expensive and the risk is too high.

threads.title: [SOLVED]Dark spot on right side of screen after LCD repair
threads.message:
No Title

Thank you Jadao and Duke.  I wouldn't have even known where to begin.  So I do see a micro-tear on the LED flex.  I've done dozens and dozens of these without an issue before.  Just glad to know then not know. Thank you : ) Started on the board side and worked my way up to the screen with your guidance : )

threads.message: [I didn't know 40V's goes threw this thing !! Wow !]
